item.title: Portal Teleport [Need help] - [718]
item.dc:creator: @Mollett Mollett
item.description:
@Mollett wrote:

[quote=“owns reece, post:2, topic:528334”]else if (componentId == OPTION_5) { stage = 80; sendOptionsDialogue("Where would you like to go?", "Falador: Giant Mole", "Ice Strykewryms", "Nevermind"); } } else if (stage == 80) { if (componentId == OPTION_1) { ShipTravelAction.TravelUser(player,1760, 5197, 0); //Giant Mole } else if (componentId == OPTION_2) { ShipTravelAction.TravelUser(player,3422, 5668, 0); //Ice wyrms } else if (componentId == OPTION_3) { end(); }[/quote]

Just saw that part and fixed it myself, thank you for the post though :’) much appreciated.

item.title: Portal Teleport [Need help] - [718]
item.dc:creator: @Mollett Mollett
item.description:
@Mollett wrote:

Hello, I am trying to fix my PortalTeleport.java when I compile I get no errors. But the only button that works in-game is the Falador: Giant Mole. I am trying to make it so that when you click on the Ice Strykewyrms It teleports you to the coordinates below and trying to make the never mind button close the dialog. Any help would be appreciated, thank you. I’m using a 718 source (Rune-evo).

else if (componentId == OPTION_5) {
                                stage = 80;
                                sendOptionsDialogue("Where would you like to go?",
                                                "Falador: Giant Mole", "Ice Strykewryms", "Nevermind");
                        }
                } else if (stage == 80) {
                        if (componentId == OPTION_1) {
                        ShipTravelAction.TravelUser(player,1760, 5197, 0); //Giant Mole
                }      
                } else if (stage == 80) {
                        if (componentId == OPTION_2) {
                        ShipTravelAction.TravelUser(player,3422, 5668, 0); //Ice wyrms
                        } else if (componentId == OPTION_3) {
                                player.getInterfaceManager().closeChatBoxInterface();
                        }

Read full topic
